Harvey Milk one of the first out gay elected officials in the U.S. was born 92 years ago today.The fight against anti-#LGBTQ discrimination continues. I voted for the #EqualityAct & the Senate should join the House in passing it!#HarveyMilkDay

This Armed Forces Day we thank all who have served the United States in uniform with honor. I’m committed to helping our veterans service members and their families access the benefits they have earned.

Cars pick-up trucks & SUVs make up 60% of trips a mile or less. That’s a lot of CO2! Joining #BikeToWorkDay - especially for short trips - is made easier thanks to the Infrastructure & Jobs Act I voted for. It provides $12 BILLION for people walking biking & rolling.

I’m proud to represent many Bangladeshi Americans in #Philadelphia! Today I met with a delegation from Bangladesh to discuss the economic social & political landscapes in their nation where I have previously visited and ways to further strengthen Bangladesh-US relations.

2/•  H.R. 7791 — Access to Baby Formula Act a bill to provide flexibility so low-income families can continue purchasing safe infant formula with WIC benefits during extenuating circumstances such as a supply chain disruption.

1/ Today I’m voting for two bills to address the baby formula shortage:• H.R. 7790 — Infant Formula Supplemental Appropriations Act 2022 which would provide $28 million in emergency funding to give the FDA the resources it needs to address the urgent infant formula shortage.
